Topic.Title: According to techstrategy . . . Amazon's hiring 50,000 seasonal workers . . .

Message.Msg: Isn't amazing how much AMZN has the same model as a bricks and mortar retailer? Expected holiday sales prompt holiday hiring. Marginal revenue increases drive marginal costs. I would have thought a revolutionary approach to retailing would have eliminated or at least diminished the linear correlation between revenue and costs. Shouldn't there be capacity in their existing structure to handle increased holiday sales?

Topic.Title: According to techstrategy . . . Amazon's hiring 50,000 seasonal workers . . .

Message.Msg: Amazon previously had a much more flexible and responsive cost structure. Now it is loaded with fixed and semi fixed costs, which will only grow as it tries to do same day delivery. Everyone has bought the "inflation" argument without thinking through who experiences the inflation. While Mitt winning might be good long term, there is no question that the "broader base lower tax rate" will increase taxes on those who pay little to none, which happens to be the segment with the highest marginal propensity to consume (since they cannot save...).

Message.Title: AMZN business is what?
Message.Msg: AMZN is getting into all kinds of businesses. Hardware, cloud, retail, music, warehouse. They are many competitors. AMZN will have to pay state excise taxes in some states; soon to be many. Margins will shrink. Business model in question. $50 stock.

Topic.Title: why did amzn drop today?

Message.Msg: Amzn will likely, or could may be better, test it's $220-225 resistance level THIS WEEK and into earnings report next week, and very probable if market drops 200 pts. When they have conf call and they guide that they will miss next quarters earnings again, the market will no longer give it a pass with no real earnings even with a 25% revenue growth. W Buffet and D Einhorn said it right when they couldn't figure out why they would be value at $105 Billion mkt cap -their business model just doesn't add up to real value-- this could easily be a stock cut in half in a matter of weeks.The trading volume is so low for such a large mkt cap company, so when it goes down hang on tight, it will be dramatic. But timing is always the question here, and if it will drop.

Topic.Title: why did amzn drop today?

Message.Msg: Meant to say" not if will drop"--it will-- and it will be dramatic-the question has always been when-- we are getting very close, but I am not yet short. The pros say wait till it hits the $220 level, because then it could hit the $180 number it was at early this year in a matter of 1 or 2 days after that. Timing is critical and put options are very expensive because mkt knows it will happen and the writers of those options want to get paid alot of money for that risk. Good luck on your timing.

Message.Title: Intel and IBM: isolated cases.
Message.Msg: Stock futures holding up very well. Today's rally in the general market was due to institutions flushed with free money (thanks to the FED) buying stocks, and usually when something like this happens, it doesn't end in just one day. The rally will continue for the next few days. AMZN didn't participate in today's rally, so she will do a catch-up tomorrow. Good luck to al!
